name: Red Cliffs Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in a River King Suite overlooking the Colorado River and it was just paradise. I loved the layout of the suite; it was so roomy and comfortable. Loved the sofa and the kitchen area. The bathroom was well appointed - robes, toiletries, etc. The best part was the private patio. I sat out there whenever we had a free moment, listening to the birds, watching the water flow, taking in the gorgeous weather and relaxing. And it was so quiet! I could have stayed for a month! The ride to and from Moab is one of the most beautiful drives I've ever experienced; and we never got tired of it. The pool area is quite huge and the views are gorgeous; laundry room w/ice machine, and gym nearby. The staff was very friendly. Did a wine tasting and enjoyed a bottle of their red out on that fantastic patio.....I want to go back.....now!
reviews.title: I loved this place

likes.liked: — The tranquility; the view from the private patio

reviews.text: We weren't certain about what to expect but the Red Cliffs Lodge was great. We had a little cabin by the Colorado River that was nice and clean and we really enjoyed our stay. We went on a river run and wished we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: We had a blast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a visit to Red Cliffs. This time we stayed in one of the new river front cabins. While the room was nice, jacuzzi and fireplace, I would recommend trying to get one of the end units. These were still being built on our stay. The others are river front but you have a view of only the rocks across from your cabin. If I couldn't get one of the cabins on the end, I would stay in one of the river view rooms. These rooms also offer the kitchenette area and the views are much more panoramic due to the placement on the property at a bend in the river. We have stayed here before and the rooms are always clean and you get the feeling of isolation on your deck even though there are many units around. Would gladly return.
reviews.title: beautiful setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When the sun rises you can see the years of spider web accumulations on the skylight windows and the wooden ceiling. The ice machine was up to 300 feet from your room and if it's raining take an umbrella. The laundry room had no dollar bill changer so a trip to the registration desk was necessary.(150 feet). The dead cricket that was next to one bed upon arrival was there when we left. Other than location this place is overpriced.
reviews.title: Over priced

reviews.text: During our whirlwind tour of SE Utah & SW Colorado, we spent one night at the Red Cliffs. The name is very appropriate as the Lodge's compound is surrounded by red rocks in all directions. We enjoyed some wonderful views of the red rock cliffs overlooking the Colorado River, which runs right next to the Lodge, both at sunset & sunrise.
reviews.title: Very nice place, but a little out of the way.

reviews.text: This is a very special place. I do alot of traveling and this is the best Lodge I have ever been to. I came to Moab with my Wife and two children ( 5 and 3 ). Check in was quick and easy with complimetary cookies handed out by the front desk. Our rooms was great, with a full dinning area and enclosed privite patio out back. Pool scene was excellent with a great views of the surrounding beautiful rock face. Very clean rooms and bathroom.
reviews.title: Heaven in Moab!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I drove 26 hours to get there and would do it every weekend if I could.
reviews.title: Spectacular!

likes.disliked: — that I didn't book more than 2 nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just spent 2 nights at the Red Cliffs Lodge. It's about 14 miles from the main road through Moab, upstream on the cliff-lined Colorado River, and it is spectacular. At ~$200/night it is not cheap, but it is an excellent value. Aside from their own buildings, there's not another structure in sight, just fantastic views of the towering red cliffs, the Colorado River, and local wildlife. They do everything right, have a terrific restaurant (we were blown away by a first-rate dinner for 2 for ~$45) and their own winery, and you wake up in paradise. The attention to detail tells me that they really do place their guests' interests first. We enjoyed it so much that when we found we could not extend our stay a night because they were completely booked on the Memorial Day weekend, we flew home a day early rather than endure the let-down of a lesser hotel in a lesser location. Although the company I used to work for would occasionally put me up in some pretty expensive places, this was the best hotel experience of my life!
reviews.title: It was brilliant

likes.liked: — The location; room facilities provided; spacious; clean; everything was perfect.

reviews.title: The locals even like this place
reviews.text: We arrived in darkness at Red Cliffs Lodge via the road from Moab, having driven up from Durango and Mesa Verde. We had no idea until we saw it in daylight just how spectacular this road was as it followed the river winding its way through the valley. Soaring red cliffs on either side, this scenic highway just has to be driven. Red Cliffs Lodge is 12 miles along this road, and we had booked a River View Mini King suite, which was quite magnificent. We couldn't believe our luck - it was beautifully furnished, spacious, very clean and exactly what the website promised. The bathroom was well designed and the bedroom huge. Going down a few steps, there was an excellent kitchen and dining area leading on to our individual patio. On waking in the morning the view took our breath away. Awesome! Looking out over the Colorado River towards the legendary "western film" backdrop of Castle Rock, it was heaven. With a few cows peacefully grazing by the river bank just yards from our patio, and enormous red cliffs to the side and behind us, we knew we could not have found a better location for a few days' stay. The Lodge breakfast was exceptionally good with a great choice of cold and cooked food, and we had the choice of eating inside or outside on the patio. The Lodge is ideally placed for Arches National Park, Canyonlands and Moab. Our two days were spent visitng Arches and hiking up Negro Bill's Canyon a few miles from the Lodge. This is a must do. We didn't have time to do any horse-riding which looked great fun from the Lodge ranch, and unfortunately it was too early to see the vineyard in all its glory. BUT one evening we experienced the most fantastic sunset. We discovered why this is called "Red Cliffs Lodge" because Castle Rock in front of us turned the most fabulous reddish colour and we were completely awestruck. You could not possibly find a better location for adventure, activities, touring or just simply relaxing and enjoying the spectacular views. We would recommend Red Cliffs Lodge to everyone. The service was first class; the evening food was very tasty; and everyone was helpful and very friendly. It was a wonderful visit and one of the best places in which we have ever stayed. Moab was heaving as the jeep safari had taken over the town for the weekend, but Red Cliffs Lodge was a little bit of heaven, peace and luxury. Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestled in the Castle Rock area, this place is tops. Staff is courteous, attentive, and bright. Restaurant is frequented by Moab locals. For the best experience, book a cabin on the Colorado -- which will be about 30 feet from your private deck. Any adventure can be booked at desk. Only drawback: it's about 15 miles to town on a winding, but very scenic, river road. But if you stay here, there is little reason to be running back and forth to town...
reviews.title: Classy and comfy

likes.disliked: — Restaurant service could have been quicker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can we say? Our long weekend getaway at Red Cliffs Logde was WONDERFUL. The natural beauty of the area is breathtaking in and of itself. From the making of reservations through checkout, the staff at Red Cliffs know true customer service. We interacted with front desk, housekeeping and restaurant staff. Everyone was courteous. Honestly, and I don't mean to sound overboard, we felt more like friends staying over at friends, rather than at a hotel. My life partner and I arrrived late and when we got there, we were greeted with warmth and friendliness, just like our entire stay. Pam, Ronne, Brittney and all the staff just added to the experience. Housekeeping, I cannot remember your names, but you were right in there as well! Front desk even had an excellent reference for a massage! To see the mighty Colorado right off of our patio was so amazing.
reviews.title: Outstanding! We will be back!

likes.liked: — Surrounding beauty of the area (southeastern Utah)

reviews.title: Fantastic find!
reviews.text: We also felt the social conscience of the lodge by their envirnmentally friendly reminders and complimentary toiletries (soaps, shampoo, etc.) and solar heated pool. Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a stay at the Red Cliffs Lodge. .
reviews.title: Clean and classy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having just spent 4 nights in a noisy lodge in Avon, Co. we were ready for some peace and a little space for our family of four. With two girls (ages 12 and 14) we appreciate that!
reviews.title: ABOVE AND BEYOND EXPECTATIONS.AND WINE, TOO!!

reviews.text: Driving through these beautiful mountains looks like something from a John Wayne movie (you'll find that many movies were made here..from Indiana Jones to many of the old John Ford movies) you come upon the lodge after a short drive from the town center (about 20 minutes). Everything was new, clean, and of high quality. I can't speak for the rooms,but would highly reccommend the cabins. Our two bedroom cabin shared a large bath, was, again brand new, made of rustic pine, and while not luxuious by Ritz Carlton standards, very roomy and comfortable. The best part was the locale. It was situated Right
reviews.title: Count me in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the opportunity to show a close friend my most favorite area in Utah. Moab is a wonderful area with very beautiful scenery. My friend was looking at websites and found the Red Cliffs Inn. She saw pictures of the executive room and the shower in the room. She knew how much I love “good clean fun” and she booked the room for our trip. What a beautiful room, beautiful location, and of course, the best shower I have ever had the pleasure of playing in. We highly recommend the executive room, it was a great time.
reviews.title: Great Romantic Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the new cabins for our "honeymoon" Right on the Colorado! It was great! Our friends came down from Salt Lake and stayed in one of the other rooms and it looked just as nice. (go on the web page and take the virtual tour!) It was hot in June and some how the pool was freezing! You could only stay in it long enough to bring your core temp down to a warm 98.5! As luck would have it they were filming "Primal Quest" for ESPN that week. It absorbed all of those people (heck, most of them were out ridding up slick rock or repelling down mountains most of the day!) without making us feel crowded.
reviews.title: rugged elegance

likes.disliked: — Lots of little flying bugs by the river!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part was enjoyng a bottle of Castle Valley wine in the cabin with our friends! Oh yes, and if you decide to stay here... please do not miss the guided horseback tour. If you're not afraid of one of God most beautiful animals that, and trust me on this... know their way around the landscape, hop on and enjoy! This is by far one of the best horseback experiences you'll ever have. The views will take your breath away.
reviews.title: Beautiful red cliffs lodge

reviews.text: In september we wanted to stay a couple of days at Moab. Unfortunately, it was a weekend with a music festival. There was really not one room available. In a motel, they told us that 18 miles from Moab, there where still rooms available in de Red Cliffs Lodge. Expensive, 170 dollars per night, but we had no choice. After a very dark drive into the middle of nowhere, we arrived at a lovely place. Big spatious rooms with kitchenette. The next day we notices stunning views, red rocks indeed and also the beautiful Colorado. In the end, we stayed 4 nights, the best place during our holiday. Breakfast was good, dinner great. The bison filet mignon steak was the best steak we ever had. And they have there own winery and stables. You can buy white and red wine. So, a recommendation worth!
reviews.title: I want to go back!

likes.disliked: — Key cards were hard to work

reviews.text: I had the pleasure of staying at the Red Cliffs Lodge for business in December of 2006. Its location is nothing short of stunning, nestled in a cliffside nook with the Colorado River just steps from your back door. It was really cold when I was there, so the river had ice in it!!! The front desk staff were very cordial and friendly. My room was a very comfortable mini-suite with a king size bed, tub & shower and kitchenette with mini-fridge, microwave, in-room coffee, etc. It was kept spotlessly clean throughout my stay. The heater worked a bit too well, but better that than the alternative given the weather!
reviews.title: Great lodging and wine in the middle of nowhere

description: Red Cliffs Lodge is nestled along Scenic Byway 128 and the Colorado River near Moab, Utah. The ranch offers deluxe accommodations with individual private patios each facing the river. New cabins with fireplaces, two bedrooms, high speed internet, all with spectacular views of White's Rapid and 2,000 ft towering red cliffs. Indoor and outdoor dining is a favorite as well as free wine tastings at Castle Creek Winery, horseback riding, rafting & hiking in the Arches National Park.
